rComments: Only did the reading mandatory for the assignments, showed up to class and left during the break mid-way through most days (attendance was mandatory). Leslie was very unclear, albeit passionate. Ignored students questions and went incredibly slow. Truly an intro course- if you know anything about activism don't waste your time.

Super interesting class and Leslie is really invested in the subject. A lot of reading and information thrown at you, but between lectures and discussions there are many opportunities to clear up any issues or confusion.

The best class I've taken in my short 2 quarters at this school. Leslie is a brilliant teacher and her accelerated Core class was as educational as it was community building. I learned so much and her passion for her subject and for social justice is infectious and inspiring. Be prepared to write a lot and work hard, but it's worth it!

Professor Lopez is a really insightful person. She interacted with the students during lecture and invited guest speakers (made the class material a lot more tangible!)   1 midterm and final are take home essays Very informative lectures Course reader was alright

Terrible teacher who expects her students to slave for her class. She's a terrible grader and a confusing lecturer, very unfair with her grading and expectations for her students. Treated an non-upper division class like an upper division class. She also posted our grades late.
has a lot of experience and good things to say, but was unclear about the midterm which ended up being not that bad. It was an interesting class but requires a fair amount of reading.

She is so passionate about youth empowerment and education! She believes that by empowering undergrads, they will then take their skills and empower others. Get to know her, she is AMAZING! The classwork is time-consuming, but totally worth doing if you want to become more knowledgable about education system and English learners

Leslie was definitely knowledgable, but I had a hard time with her teaching style. Granted, this was the first time this course was taught, but it was pretty disorganized assignment- and guest speaker-wise. She warmed up to the class later in the quarter, but the beginning was rough.  The subject definitely is interesting though!
Being in this class was an invaluable experience, and especially with a professor who puts so much heart into lectures. If you get the chance take one of her classes!
She IS the best professor I've had at UCSC. She is incredibly dedicated and such an inspiration. Her heart is really in her work. If you take her class, get to know her! She is awesome!

This class is mind-opening! The material in the class is very interesting and great for anyone interested in politics. The class is not very difficult as long as you do the readings. Be prepared for quiet a bit of reading everyday but with very interesting information. One midterm that is fairly easy and a take home final of 3 essays
Great teacher.

Professor López is interested in her subject and very knowledgeable. Her problem is lecturing. She doesn't handle lectures well. She lets students bully her on some topics, but is steadfast on others, leading to many arguments. Quizzes were SO badly written that she ended up throwing out most questions AFTER we took the quiz. Easy but frustrating

Man Leslie is really one horrible teacher. She cannot handle large classes. If the class was a seminar then she would rock! But otherwise; she's not confident, strays off topic, lacks command over subject, is confusing, stubborn, worst PPT slides and lectures ever. Go to section, you'll need it. Awesome/easy subject and class, horrible teacher.

Lopez was an enthusiastic teacher who conveyed passion and knowledge. With regards to her political change in mexico class, it was clear that she also an activist, which makes learning from her more fun. Good teacher if a bit absent-minded at times.

Leslie Lopez is AMAZING, and so is her class! She knows exactly what she's talking about and although she can be a little confused at times, she really has a lot of interesting and relevant things to say. You can really tell she loves the subject and is passionate about teaching. She is extremely helpful and wants to know her students.

Leslie is a great teacher that is very devoted to her work, she is always willing to give an extra helping hand to those who WANT it.  Made the amterial very interesting, not too strict on grading, and grades based on improvement she sees throughout a student's work.  Highly recommended!

Leslie is an AMAZING teacher!  Political Change in Mexico was very well taught, full of information, yet crystal clear in form.  I highly recommend this class to everyone.  She is super helpful if you have questions, and she takes all comments and ideas seriously.   Even in a class of 70, she got to know everyone, and puts time into grading papers.

Dedicated and enthusiastic about journalism.  She left extensive comments on all my written work AND sent me long emails when I needed help.  Approachable and friendly.  She might suck for Core, but that's because Core is lame.  Take one of her other classes, it will be sweet.
not very helpful. flaky. not a very good teacher.
Leslie was very helpful in teaching the introductory core class. She made you feel comfortable and although there was a lot of work, it was worth the experience.

She can be very ambiguous at times which can be frustrating and troubling, but you can just ask her what she means and she'll usually clarify.  Great course, great teachcher, but unfortunately pressed for time in the discussions area.
Her Political Change in Mexico class was not very well taught.  She seemed to make her information up as she went along.  When she didn't agree with an opinion, she would ignore it and move on.

Leslie's class is sometimes interesting, but not necessarily thought-provoking. She'll sometimes disregard student's comments because she doesn't agree with them. Participate a lot and show interest in the course and you'll ace it easily.
